metadata.title: CVE-2022-37703 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
In Amanda 3.5.1, an information leak vulnerability was found in the calcsize SUID binary. An attacker can abuse this vulnerability to know if a directory exists or not anywhere in the fs. The binary will use `opendir()` as root directly without checking the path, letting the attacker provide an arbitrary path.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

amanda-client - 1:3.5.1-9ubuntu0.3
amanda-common - 1:3.5.1-9ubuntu0.3
amanda-server - 1:3.5.1-9ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: amanda package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.1-9ubuntu0.3').
